description:
I have ported the `spectral_integrator` analysis module to 3.0. Main changes:   

1) Unitifying everything.    
2) Defaulting the `H_number_density` to the primordial value if it's not defined in the frontend. Since checking for the field necessitated looking it up in the `field_info`, it is now required to pass in the `Dataset` object. The fields are added to the `Dataset` `field_info`.    
3) Adding the photon unit to the `unit_lookup_table`.   
4) Fixed a few bugs from the previous version.   
5) Consolidating the field generation into one function, to avoid code duplication, and since field generation really only needs to be done once.    

Also fixed some PEP-8 violations in `photon_simulator`.
title: Porting spectral integrator to 3.0

content.raw: All tests pass. Good job!
content.html: All tests pass. Good job!

content.html: John ZuHone, this looks great! Thank you for doing this!

content.raw:
So now what I have done is included a collisionally ionized table based on AtomDB (http://www.atomdb.org), but the default is to still use the old table, which, to distinguish, is now renamed "cloudy_emissivity.h5". The docs and the install script have been updated accordingly. 

I also fixed a couple of bugs in `photon_simulator`.
content.html:
So now what I have done is included a collisionally ionized table based on AtomDB (http://www.atomdb.org), but the default is to still use the old table, which, to distinguish, is now renamed "cloudy_emissivity.h5". The docs and the install script have been updated accordingly.

I also fixed a couple of bugs in photon_simulator.

content.raw:
Hi @jzuhone, the changes look good to me.  I have only a couple comments.

1. Line 164 of the ``spectral_frequency_integrator.py`` refers to "xray_emissivity.h5" as the default filename.  Can you change that?

2. I made x-ray surface brightness projections of a small cosmology dataset I had on hand and noticed that the Cloudy and Apec fields differ on the maximum brightness by 10 orders of magnitude.  Can you check with some data of yours and see if you get the same?
content.html:
Hi John ZuHone, the changes look good to me. I have only a couple comments.

  1. Line 164 of the spectral_frequency_integrator.py refers to "xray_emissivity.h5" as the default filename. Can you change that?

  2. I made x-ray surface brightness projections of a small cosmology dataset I had on hand and noticed that the Cloudy and Apec fields differ on the maximum brightness by 10 orders of magnitude. Can you check with some data of yours and see if you get the same?

content.raw: Do you happen to know what the density and temperature is in those extreme cells?
content.html: Do you happen to know what the density and temperature is in those extreme cells?

content.raw: Hi @jzuhone, I think I was a bit hasty with that statement.  I made some phase plots and projections and was more careful about setting limits and they look actually very similar.  I was thrown off by the crazy dynamic range you get from these fields, which can be more than 100 orders of magnitude.  Sorry for the noise, everything looks great!
content.html: Hi John ZuHone, I think I was a bit hasty with that statement. I made some phase plots and projections and was more careful about setting limits and they look actually very similar. I was thrown off by the crazy dynamic range you get from these fields, which can be more than 100 orders of magnitude. Sorry for the noise, everything looks great!

content.raw: HI @jzuhone, one final comment.  I think it may be worth it to specifically mention the Apec table as an option in the docstrings and/or documentation.  Without that, it's likely that no one will ever know it's there.
content.html: HI John ZuHone, one final comment. I think it may be worth it to specifically mention the Apec table as an option in the docstrings and/or documentation. Without that, it's likely that no one will ever know it's there.

content.raw: This is now ready to go in.
content.html: This is now ready to go in.
